com.facebook.buck.rules

Class AbstractCachingBuildRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.rules.AbstractCachingBuildRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BuildRule, Comparable<BuildRule>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidBinaryRule, AndroidManifestRule, AndroidResourceRule, DefaultJavaLibraryRule, ExportFileRule, GenAidlRule, GenParcelableRule, Genrule, JavaBinaryRule, KeystoreRule, NativeLibraryRule, PrebuiltJarRule, PythonBinaryRule, PythonLibraryRule, ShTestRule

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractCachingBuildRule
extends Object
implements BuildRule
    Abstract implementation of a BuildRule that can be cached. If its current RuleKey matches the one on disk, then it has no work to do. It should also try to fetch its output from an ArtifactCache to avoid doing any computation.

    TODO(mbolin, simons): This should be converted from an abstract class that relies on inheritance to a final class that takes an object that implements the following methods:

    • getInputsToCompareToOutput()
    • buildInternal()
    • appendToRuleKey()
    • recordOutputFileDetailsAfterFetchFromArtifactCache()
    Ultimately, we plan to define a BuildRuleDescriptor, from which we will at least be able to provide the implementation of getInputsToCompareToOutput() and appendToRuleKey() automatically. How we plan to generify the ABI logic is up in the air.

    • Method Detail

      • isRuleBuilt

        protected final boolean isRuleBuilt()
        This rule is designed to be used for precondition checks in subclasses. For example, before running the tests associated with a build rule, it is reasonable to do a sanity check to ensure that the rule has been built.

      • getBuildResultType

        public BuildRuleSuccess.Type getBuildResultType()
        Description copied from interface: BuildRule
        Returns the way in which this rule was built.

        IMPORTANT: This rule must have finished building before this method is invoked.

        Specified by:
        getBuildResultType in interface BuildRule

      • getInputsToCompareToOutput

        protected abstract Iterable<String> getInputsToCompareToOutput()
        Get the set of input files whose contents should be hashed for the purpose of determining whether this rule is cached.

        Note that the collection of inputs is specified as a list, because for some build rules (such as Genrule), the order of the inputs is significant. If the order of the inputs is not significant for the build rule, then the list should be alphabetized so that lists with the same elements will be .equals() to one another.

      • getInputs

        public Iterable<InputRule> getInputs()
        Specified by:
        getInputs in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        the inputs needed to build this build rule

      • appendToRuleKey

        protected RuleKey.Builder appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder builder)
        getRuleKey() and createRuleKeyWithoutDeps() uses this when constructing RuleKeys for this class. Every subclass that extends the rule state in a way that matters to idempotency must override appendToRuleKey(com.facebook.buck.rules.RuleKey.Builder) and append its state to the RuleKey.Builder returned by its superclass's appendToRuleKey(com.facebook.buck.rules.RuleKey.Builder) implementation. Example: 
         @Override
 protected RuleKey.Builder appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder builder) {
   return super.appendToRuleKey(builder)
       .set("srcs", srcs),
       .set("resources", resources);
 }

      • build

      • recordOutputFileDetailsAfterFetchFromArtifactCache

        protected void recordOutputFileDetailsAfterFetchFromArtifactCache(ArtifactCache cache,
                                                      ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
                                                           throws IOException
        This method is invoked if the output file is successfully fetched from the ArtifactCache. This is where a rule has the opportunity to record any relevant metadata about the artifact.

        The default implementation of this method is empty.

        Parameters:
        cache - The ArtifactCache that was used to fetch the output file.
        projectFilesystem - to use to determine where a metadata file should be written.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buildInternal

        protected abstract List<Step> buildInternal(BuildContext context)
                                     throws IOException
        When this method is invoked, all of its dependencies will have been built.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • initializeFromDisk

        protected boolean initializeFromDisk(ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
        For a rule that is read from the build cache, it may have fields that would normally be populated by executing the steps returned by buildInternal(BuildContext). Because buildInternal(BuildContext) is not invoked for cached rules, a rule may need to implement this method to populate those fields in some other way. For a cached rule, this method will be invoked just before the future returned by build(BuildContext) is resolved.

        By default, this method does nothing except return true.

        Parameters:
        projectFilesystem - can be used to load
        Returns:
        whether the internal data structures were populated successfully.

      • getOutputKey

        public OutputKey getOutputKey(ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
        Description copied from interface: BuildRule
        If the BuildRule has an output (as reported by getOutput()), return the OutputKey associated with the file returned by getOutput(); return a non-idempotent OutputKey otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getOutputKey in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        key based on the BuildRule's output contents if getOutput() returns non-null; a nonIdempotent OutputKey otherwise. A missing/unreadable output file results in a non-idempotent OutputKey.
